newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran seizes 800 kg of opium, kills one smuggler.
newsitem.headline: Iran seizes 800 kg of opium, kills one smuggler.

text.p: Iran said on Sunday it had seized 800 kg (1,764 lb) of opium after clashes with drug traffickers in northern Iran in which one smuggler was killed.
"Other traffickers fled the scene, leaving behind a number of...rocket launchers, some ammunition and an AK-47 assault rifle," Iran's official news agency IRNA said.
The clashes near the border with Turkmenistan took place on Saturday and Sunday, IRNA said.

According to Iranian law, possession of five kg (11 lb) of opium or 30 grammes (just over an ounce) of heroin is punishable by death. More than 1,000 people have been executed in drug-related cases since the law took effect in 1989.
Iran is a key transit route for drugs, mostly opium from which heroin is made, being smuggled to Europe via Turkey from Afghanistan and Pakistan -- the so-called "Golden Crescent".
